website_summaries.verdict: Oxbow’s first-class pellet formula is composed of healthy hand-picked garden grasses, grains, and veggies, making for a winning combo of delicious tastes and superior ingredients.
pros: Timothy grass, sunflower meal, canola meal, oat grass, and orchard grass are the first five ingredients
Tomato, thyme, and yellow peas added for flavor and nutrition
cons: A fairly pricey chinchilla food, but these pellets are a top-tier formula that is worth the price

customer_reviews.title: WILL NEVER PURCHASE FROM THIS SELLER AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: The food is great. It's the healthiest I can feed my little ones. HOWEVER, I will never purchase from this seller ever again. My item was expired. I requested to send a replacement and the replacement came EXPIRED as well. The previous order I made before- the food expired the day after I recieved it. They also try to cover expiration date with sticker so they know they are selling you OLD FOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only true Chinchilla food
customer_reviews.text: The product is the first that I have found that is actually made for Chinchillas. Timothy grass is the first ingredient where all other Chinchilla food has Alfalfa hay first. Alfalfa can cause urinary problems with Chinchillas. I would like to see the cost come down but will pay for quality and what is nutritionally beneficial as opposed to rabbit food with a Chinchilla photo on the bag. Good work Oxbow, you have proven your company once again to be a trustworthy brand for our pets. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Alice Smith

customer_reviews.title: It’s a no from Chinchy
customer_reviews.text: Whatever it was about this food, she hated it. I’ve always fed Oxbow so I trusted the name. She’d dump more than half the bowl and we went through this bag super fast. She couldn’t wait to get rid of it. 👀 I picked up the regular oxbow tonight. Everyone’s happy. This is the ‘new coke’ of oxbow chinchilla food. 😂😂 don’t do it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my chinchilla
customer_reviews.text: My chinchilla won't eat this and I can't really blame him....
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Brand recommended. They know what they are making
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to assume my chinchilla likes it because he just doesn’t stop eating it. I thought it would be hard to get him to switch to a different food since the brand before had small apple peices in it but he seems to like this one better.
customer_reviews.author: Quinton

customer_reviews.title: My chin loves it!
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion it’s the best chinchilla food you can get
customer_reviews.author: ashting

customer_reviews.title: Different but Good
customer_reviews.text: This must be a newer diet for Chinchilla's as I have never heard of it before. My Chinchilla seems to really like this food. It has a "spice" smell to it, which is interesting. She was on the original Oxbow diet for Chins prior to this. The pellet size in this diet is larger than the original chin diet which isn't a bad thing. I like this food, just wish it was a little cheaper but if you want a healthy food then you need to spend more money.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Ashie loves it
customer_reviews.text: My Chinchilla loves her pellets. Hopefully they will keep up the non-gmo aspect of it.
customer_reviews.author: Deena L

customer_reviews.title: Not healthy or safe for chins.
customer_reviews.text: This food is not safe or advised for chinchillas. It is not healthy for chinchillas due to the tomato ingredient which can cause long-term damage over time. Stick to the regular chinchilla pellets for them with a mixture of hay (as much as they can eat). Thankfully I know a chinchilla rescue/expert that has raised 50+ chinchillas and found homes for hundreds over the years that warned me before I wasted money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Oxbow products in general for my furbabies, but this was not a hit. I only bought these because I was in a pinch and their normal pellets (regular oxbow ones in the red bag) were scheduled to take a while to ship. They smelled kind of funny, and my boys didn't touch them. They picked the old pellets out of their bowl instead. Appears healthier but likely not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: GeneQueen09

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: Please do NOT buy this pellet. It's not safe for chinchillas. Chinchillas are not supposed to have any fruits or veggies, which are ingredients in this pellet, as the sugar content is way too high for them. It's not healthy to them in the way humans may perceive it to be. Stick to the Oxbow Essentials Chinchilla Food! It's the same brand pellet, just safe and healthy for your chinchilla. Oxbow Essentials Chinchilla Food is actually 1 of the 2 best pellets for your chinchilla in the U.S.! Let's help keep our fur babies alive for as long as possible because we all know they can live for a very long time. :)
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Chin hated it.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this at my local pet store and normally I get oxbow food for my chin so I had some trust for the brand. However my chin hated it, she refuses to touch it and after reading reviews I can see why. Multi complains on bad ingredients made me lose trust in oxbow.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Please do not by the Garden Select bag. This type has ingredients that are very bad for chinchillas to eat. I would 100% recommend the Oxbow Essentials food.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiBookDragon

product_meta.title: Oxbow Garden Select Fortified Food for Chinchillas
product_meta.description: Size:3 lbs**NOW AVAILABLE! ! ! ** Hand-picked and wholesome – just like your chinchilla. Garden Select Chinchilla is a complete and balanced chinchilla food, with a flavor profile hand-picked from Mother Nature’s kitchen. Select garden ingredients such as whole yellow pea, tomato, rosemary, and thyme give Garden Select its delectable, garden fresh flavor while a blend of three varieties of hand-selected hay provides essential fiber. All Garden Select varieties are Project Non-GMO certified. Size: 3 lbs Ingredients Timothy Grass, Sunflower Meal, Canola Meal, Oat Grass, Orchard Grass, Oat Hulls, Whole Barley, Tomato Pomace (dehydrated), Whole Yellow Pea, Monocalcium Phosphate, Calcium Sulfate, Oatmeal, Flaxseed, Lignin Sulfonate, Canola Oil, Salt, Sodium Bentonite, Rosemary, Thyme, Yeast Culture (dehydrated), Hydrolyzed Yeast, Inulin, Choline Chloride, DL-Methionine, Vitamin E Supplement, Zinc Sulfate, Zinc Proteinate, Niacin, Copper Sulfate, d-Calcium Pantothenate, Vitamin A Supplement, Manga nous Oxide, Riboflavin Supplement, Biotin, Thiamine Mononitrate, Magnesium Sulfate, Copper Proteinate, Sodium Selenite, Manganese Proteinate, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Folic Acid, Vitamin D3 Supplement, Cobalt Carbonate, Vitamin B12 Supplement, Calcium Iodate Analysis Crude Protein (min) 16. 00% Crude Fat (min) 2. 50% Crude Fiber (min) 18. 00% Crude Fiber (max) 23. 00% Moisture (max) 10. 00% Calcium (min) 0. 80% Calcium (max) 1. 30% Phosphorus (min) 0. 50% Vitamin A (min) 10, 000 IU/kg Vitamin D (min) 900 IU/kg Vitamin E (min) 190 IU/kg
feature_bullets: Features three varieties of grass hay to support variety & meal enrichment
Contains unique, high-quality garden ingredients that mimic those found in your pet’s natural foraging environment
